alert.note: Alert for Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 07 at 3:56PM MDT until September 07 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: .The Red Flag Warning for the Okanogan Valley and Waterville Plateau for Thursday has been extended into Friday in anticipation of continued dry north winds. The Red Flag Warning for the mountainous zones of north central and northeast Washington has been extended through Thursday morning due to poor humidity recovery and gusty ridge top winds through the night. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL IDAHO PANHANDLE... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 101 Northern and Central Idaho Panhandle (Zone 101). * Winds: Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 20 mph. Ridge top gusts as high as 30 mph. * Timing: Through this evening. * Relative Humidities: 15 to 20 percent lowlands and 20 to 30 percent mountains. * Temperatures: Lowland temperatures in mid 80s to near 90. * Impacts: Gusty winds along with very dry humidity could cause current fires to spread. * Additional Information: Thursday and Friday will be dry and breezy as well. Parts of north Idaho around Bonners Ferry and Sandpoint may flirt with critical wind and humidity thresholds Thursday and Friday as well.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
